results.title: Behind the menu
results.brief_description: A warning against unsanitary conditions in restaurants, and a demonstration of precautions that should be taken against dirt and harmful bacteria in the handling of food. Suggestions are made for increasing efficiency through better food storage, dishwashing methods and staff facilities. Measures taken by public health authorities to maintain standards in restaurants.

results.title: F.H. Greenway
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Behind the Legend”.
Introduced by Manning Clarke, the film proficiently reconstructs the story of Francis Greenway’s relationship and court case with Edward Sanderson of the N.S.W. Corps, and gives glimpses of the conditions in the colony under the Governorship of Macquarie. Written by Joanne Bean, the cast includes John Ewart as Francis Greenway and Nick Tate as Captain Sanderson.

results.title: Wm Bligh
results.creator_credit: John Croyston, Alan Burke, ABC and ABC-TV (Australia)
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Behind the Legend”.
Presents a dramatized re-enactment of the events surrounding the arrest of Governor William Bligh by the New South Wales Corps in 1808. Various witnesses present their accounts of cowardice and misappropriation by Bligh. Introduced by Manning Clark and written by Thomas Keneally. Cast includes Brian James as Bligh, Peter Gwynne, Richard Meikle, Kevin Leslie, John Trenaman, Robyn Nevin.

results.title: Behind the flyways
results.creator_credit: Rex Gary Schmidt and United States. Fisheries and Wildlife Service
results.brief_description: This film illustrates how data is gathered on the North American continent for use in making water-fowl regulations. Depicts all types of water-fowl hunting. Shows biologists and other personnel making field studies from Mexico to the Arctic on land, water and in the air. Explains how the information obtained is used in developing regulations.

results.title: Behind the big top
results.brief_description: Wirth’s circus comes to town! The arrival of the circus at Melbourne and their preparations for a performance. Suitable for children 6+ years old.
results.description: Wirth’s circus comes to town! The arrival of the circus at Melbourne and their preparations for a performance. Suitable for children 6+ years old.

results.title: Behind the airline
results.creator_credit: Frank Coffey, H.G. Guinness, Movietonenews and Qantas Empire Airways
results.brief_description: December 1953 was the 50th anniversary of heavier than air flight. This film compares the early flights by the Wright Brothers in America and W.E. Hart in Australia, with the highly complex organization of a modern international airline in Australia. The film illustrates the many activities of airline personnel, all of whom play their part in keeping aircraft in the air. Commentary by Harry Dearth, photography by Syd Wood.

results.title: Behaviour patterns at one year
results.creator_credit: Arnold Gesell and Yale Clinic of Child Development
results.brief_description: Portrays the behaviour patterns of a normal infant fifty-two weeks of age. The baby’s manipulation and other reactions to one, two, three, and ten cubes are interpreted and discussed by the narrator. Continues with the study of other test situations involving a cup and a spoon, cup and cubes, pellet, pellet and bottle, ball, ring and string, paper and crayon, a performance box, and a form board.

results.title: Behavior of gases
results.creator_credit: Gene Kearney, John Friedman, Lee Grodzins and Educational Services Incorporated
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “PSSC physics”.
The Brownian motion as applicable to smoke particles is shown by photomicrography and compared with a mechanical analogue. Animation is used to develop a model for gas pressure based on chaotic molecular motion. This chaotic motion is contrasted with the orderly behaviour of gases as shown by an experiment illustrating Boyle’s Law. Suitable for upper secondary level.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Gene Kearney, John Friedman, Lee Grodzins and Educational Services Incorporated

results.title: Behaviour modification: teaching language to psychotic children (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: O-Ivor Lovaas, Robert Aller and Appleton-Century-Crofts
results.brief_description: Shows typical speech patterns of autistic and schizophrenic children, and discusses correction of these before learning begins. Demonstrates instruction methods in imitation of sounds, labelling of objects, discrimination between alternatives, recall of experiences, and development of some spontaneity.
